title: Welcome all.
text:
I go by Professor Alexander and this is my teaching and learning site. My goal is to contribute to the world by improving how we learn, our collective knowledge of history and injustice and, importantly, understanding how to integrate theory, quantification, and formal mathematics into these conversations in ways that are productive to the material lives of our neighbors, critical, and systems-oriented.


Columbia University, PhD, 2015
Columbia University, MS, 2011
New York University, MA, 2008
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, BA, 2007
National University of Singapore, Exchange Student, 2005



I have been a teacher for more than 15 years. Currently, I am on the faculty at Howard University, where I hold a dual appointment in the Center for Applied Data Science and Analytics (CADSA) and the School of Education. Most recently, I was a member of the mathematics faculty at Morehouse College in Atlanta, GA. Prior to my time in Atlanta, I was a professor at the University of San Francisco and a high school mathematics teacher in Oakland, CA.
I am also the founding director of the Quantitative Histories Workshop, a community-centered teaching and learning lab for students and faculty at Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs). If you are interested in learning more, complete this form. You can view my personal website at professornaite.com.
Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
